comment: Avoid unless you like to spend money and work hard only to fail a class. Unclear directions. She makes mistakes grading constantly and you have to point them out immediately to be corrected. Takes a week to reply to emails only to be filled with typos. Can't form a sentence but expects graduate work for 2000 level course. Wants students to fail.

The absolute worst experience I have ever encountered with someone who is supposed to be an educator. Assignments are unclear and filled with typos. I spent 15 hours on the excel project only to find out she didn't include all of the information needed to complete the assignment 3 days before it was due. Syllabus filled with typos & incorrect dates

Do not take. 36 min / 50 question midterm, online quizzes have been poorly set up, group work is not very explanatory, lack of response through email and postings, and above entry level expectations with no explanation. Would never take again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Do not take her online.  No response to emails, no clarification on any assignment, over entry level expectations. She thinks you know how to code, do accounting, and write business proposals with little to no help. She asks for things that can not be done. She asked us to visit the career center when it was closed the whole week.

She was a very sweet professor. Always willing to help with quick responses! There is a group project but it wasn't too difficult. She extended a few of our projects because her directions weren't clear, she is very understanding. The class is not very difficult.  I would take her again in the future for sure!

Very deceptive when you first begin the class she is always online and available, but as time goes by expect to hear from her two days later She gives multiple assignments that link to each other but has absolutely nothing to do with the class You really have to check your grades dealing with her She does not know how to grade DO NOT TAKE

Horrible professor. Yes most people are capable of passing this class, but it will not be easy. Instructions are always unclear and if you ask her for help on anything her answer is to call IT/ figure it out. Don't take unless you have some accounting under your belt or else you will fail miserably with the Excel assignment. Tutoring is necessary.

Professor gives 17 quizzes throughout the class and one will be dropped(quiz 2nd day and many people hadn't gotten the book yet). Quizzes often have wrong answers and your quiz could be a lot harder than your classmates. Her rubric is very vague and points will be taken off for a lot that is not on there. Easy class, but would never take her again.

Professor Ingraham is a very organized teacher. I enjoyed taking her course because she made sure you were learning the material instead of scrapping by. If you miss a class, you miss a quiz and this could really hurt your grade. She is an interactive teacher which is greatly appreciated especially if you work full time and take evening classes.

she is the worst teacher I have ever take in my life, she makes quizzes every class , they are some project we have to do but only she gives instructions you have to find out how to do it without a clue, she does not care about student, avoid her.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR .. There are quizzes every single class and the quizzes count as 15% of your grade.  There is a midterm and a final and 5 assignments that you will do throughout the class.  She will give you instructions but they are not COMPLETELY clear on what she wants.  Attendance matters and she can be moody at times so BEWARE.
Thinks we are all going to cheat on quizzes and tests. Grades EXTREMELY harshly. EXTREMELY. Do NOT take. She also does not care about her students. It's just a paycheck that makes her feel smart.

If you miss being treated like you're a high school student then this is the prof for you! Want a quiz almost every class? Get on that waiting list. Want the teacher version of a textbook? Don't miss this opportunity! This class is overcomplicated for what it is, and the prof clearly has never been in the real world! Easy A if you read and show up.

There is an online quiz every class so prepare to read! The book you buy comes with a code that will quiz you its very helpful. The midterm and Final exam is identical to the study guide which helped my grade a bunch! Watch out if you turn in anything passed 11:59 you will receive a 0 no exceptions. Can be an easy A if you are clear on instructions

There are a few things that will keep you ahead. Do the  chapter reading, all you need is an overview. Only thing that got me is that you must go through grading rubric line for line to make sure you meet the requirements on the projects. She clarifies items if you ask. Moody only when majority (90%) didn't read and expected spoon feeding in class.

This professor is awful. The group project(paper and presentation) is worth 25% of your grade. Wants you to participate in class. Assignments are very time consuming and grading is very inconsistent.  The midterm and final are open book, but makes it more difficult than it has to be. Very moody as well. Wouldn't recommend.

The midterm and final are right off the study guide. There is a group project worth 25% of your grade. She does not grade well, her rubrics look simple enough, but she isn't clear and you lose a lot of points. She does not accept late work even under emergency circumstances. Take her if you have time and are meticulous. I wouldn't take her again.

This teacher was very confusing. She has a rubric for grading the projects, but adds her own opinion while grading them. Not a fair grader at all. Spent about 9 hours on the excel assignment and still got an 80. She also treated me like a high schooler by making me move to the front of the class for no reason.. Don't take her if you like busy work.

Great Prof! She is very helpful. Projects are super easy, just follow the rubric. Midterm is EXACTLY like the study guide and is open book if your class votes to have open book on midterm and final, but you have to come to class and take about 16 quizzes throughout the whole semester which don't count much and are directly from the powerpoint/book.

Pretty easy class but she does not go over how to do projects enough. Projects are due back to back and she excepts you to know how to do everything already. If you ask for help, you'll get help but she can be moody at times....
Awesome teacher. Very Helpful
